111.description: Jimmy Saville abuse scandal and BBC suppressing earlier reports? Same issues?

112.description:
Jimmy Saville abuse scandal and BBC suppressing earlier reports? Same issues? Isn't it time the Government stopped playing games with Half-truths and misleading Public statements and statistics about NHS Dentistry in England?
It isn't Nationally available to all 50million+ citizens
It isn't Health and Prevention based
It isn't a Service that is free to all regardless of income

NHS Dentistry still accounts for less than half of ALL dentistry spending in England.

It is time that Government acted by FIRST diagnosing publically that without doubling funding, NHS dentistry cannot meet everyone's clinical needs realistically.
Only then can it devise it's first ever National Dental Strategy, that takes the long-term view, transends artificial medical and social care barriers and synergises (rather than demonises) with Private dental options too, in the Public Interest overall.
We demand action now, not more patching up old problems and a reluctance to admit The Big Lie publically!

133.description: Vatican 'cannot rescind Savile honour' - The Vatican has said it would never have given the British TV presenter Jim...

134.description:
Vatican 'cannot rescind Savile honour' - The Vatican has said it would never have given the British TV presenter Jim...  The Vatican has said it would
  never have given the British
  TV presenter Jimmy Savile his
  papal knighthood had it known
  of allegations that he was a
  child sex predator, but that
  it could not rescind the
  honour now that he had died.  The Catholic Church of England
  wrote to the Holy See last
  week, asking it to consider
  whether it could posthumously
  remove the honor awarded to
  Savile because of the many
  recent child sex abuse
  allegations against him.
  
Savile, a BBC children's
  television host, died last
  year, aged 84. The church said its leader, Archbishop of Westminster Vincent Nichols, made the request because the "deep distress" of his alleged
   victims and in light of public
   concerns about his name
   remaining on the papal honors
   lists.
